title: Redesign team member images with glassmorphic theme, suitable sizing, and enhancement

requirements.text: Redesign both team member profile images in TeamMembersPage.tsx to use a glassmorphic frame: apply a frosted-glass card effect (backdrop-blur, semi-transparent background, subtle border with white/light opacity) around each member's photo, ensuring the image is displayed at a consistent and suitable size (e.g., 200Ã—200px or similar square dimensions) with rounded corners and a soft glowing border to match the existing dark futuristic glassmorphism theme.

quotes: change both the images design into suitable size with glass morphic theme and also enhance it

acceptanceCriteria: Both team member photos (Naveen V and Saarumathi A) are displayed at a consistent, suitable size within a glassmorphic frame.
The image container uses backdrop-blur, semi-transparent background, and a glowing or frosted border consistent with the app's glassmorphic design system.
Images have rounded corners and do not appear stretched or cropped awkwardly.
The fallback initials avatar also inherits the same glassmorphic styling.
The carousel layout remains functional and responsive after the redesign.

requirements.text: Enhance both team member profile images visually: apply CSS-level enhancements such as brightness boost, slight contrast increase, and a subtle inner glow or drop-shadow to make the photos appear more vibrant and polished within the glassmorphic frames.
acceptanceCriteria: Team member photos appear visually enhanced (brighter, higher contrast) compared to plain rendering.
A subtle glow or shadow effect is applied to the image element or its container.
Enhancements are consistent for both members.
Enhancements do not degrade readability of surrounding text or UI elements.

constraints: Do not alter the carousel navigation logic or auto-advancing behavior in TeamMembersPage.tsx.
Do not modify any files under frontend/src/hooks/ or frontend/src/components/ui.
Maintain consistency with the existing dark futuristic glassmorphism theme defined in frontend/src/index.css and tailwind.config.js.
nonGoals: Adding new team members or changing member data.
Replacing or swapping the actual image assets.
Changing the overall page layout beyond the image frame design.
